tweets.text: It is with this same line of thinking, surrounded with the profound stupidity all around us, that I keep feeling pulled to tweeting cynical or negative reactions to it all- so instead I will lean in- and use this as an opportunity to try to find things to be positive about
So, as an impatient person, in my best moments when I am frustrated with how slow someone is in line or walking in front of me, I think “thank you”– and dwell in the opportunity to practice patience

@zseward 1) yes 2) it happens, but usually after finding you like a similar podcast, rare to say “sit here and listen to this new thing”
Trying to figure out if “Make news like Apple makes products” is good advice or not
It's more valuable to not bother me with things I don't care about than for your news org to have a story on everything that's ever happened
The line between news and gossip has blurred beyond any possible recognition.
Seems like the news should only be doing 3 things: covering very important things happening now, explaining past things, & finding new ones
News orgs ignore a basic truth about our world: there isn’t something so important every American should know about it every single day.
That is to say, even if your craft is useful, and you’re good at it, you can do it too much. There’s a time and a place.
24 hours news is like a plumber who completes one job and moves on to installing toilets in the rest of the rooms in the house.

Go phone, still got battery 36 hours later. Because I got up at 12am yesterday. Okay, I didn't. But it makes the math easier.
Didn't charge my phone or my iPod. I'll power through the day I suppose. Roar roar.

commits.message: refactor: centralize theme exporters and eliminate code duplication
fix: use --legacy-peer-deps in CI to resolve vitest conflict
feat: add GitHub Pages deployment with live demo link
chore: cleanup zombie code and fix colorblind mode persistence
fix(theme): switch dark mode backgrounds to true black (#000000)
feat(zsh): add zsh-lux plugin for system appearance auto-detection
feat(theme): migrate to vulpes-reddish2 across all tools
feat: add visual effects controls (opacity, blur, transparency)
feat: make ALL colors fully editable (base, hint, fg, bg, comment + individual color controls)
feat: add visible custom color tooltip with full color info
feat: add vulpes-greenish theme variant
feat: add interactive color tooltips with swatch highlighting
refactor(nvim): simplify theme setup, use auto-dark-mode properly
fix(nvim): wire up vulpes-reddish colorscheme with auto-dark-mode
feat: add vulpes-reddish theme across all tools
feat: add export modal with theme naming and format selection
feat: add independent saturation control for light mode
fix(ghostty): add missing catppuccin_mocha dark theme
chore: remove temp/garbage files
feat: add harpoon, surround, tmux-fingers, and yazi plugins with full documentation
docs: add sample theme exports for all TUI targets
docs: add comprehensive multi-format theme export specification
fix(nvim): audit cleanup - fix plugin specs and consolidate snacks config
fix(colorscheme): make all UI panels transparent in light mode
fix(colorscheme): apply dark/light backgrounds dynamically
fix(config): audit cleanup - remove ayu, fix zsh themes, add auto-reload
feat(ui): add minimalist statusline with filename and position
fix(theme): only override backgrounds in dark mode, preserve light mode colors
style(reading): make more better
remove dupe kindle highlights
chore: remove unused files
docs: better document folder-to-blogpost
refactor: turn photo folder to markdown blog post instead of HTML
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/ejfox/nuxt-template-2023
build: add @nuxt/ui to nuxt.config
Add making of video to README
feat: init Obsidian plugin
docs: clarify goals in README
refactor: use <ContentDoc /> to use Nuxt Content for page content
init
